thread.section_title: Simon Bird says The Inbetweeners is over and our hearts are broken – Metro
thread.title: Simon Bird says The Inbetweeners is over and our hearts are broken
thread.title_full: Simon Bird says The Inbetweeners is over and our hearts are broken

author: Adam Starkey
title: Simon Bird says The Inbetweeners is over and our hearts are broken
text:
Clunge? Friend? Bus wankers? It’s all over.
The show began back in 2008 and ran for 18 episodes across three series, following the teenage struggles of Simon, Will, Jay and Neil with outrageous catchphrases galore.
Speaking about the impact of the franchise, Simon revealed how he’s heckled with the show’s finest lines on a regular basis.
Simon Bird played Will MacKenzie on the show (Picture: Karwai Tang/WireImage) ‘Bus wanker. Briefcase wanker. All the wankers,’ Simon said. ‘Sometimes just plain old wanker.
‘I’ve got no right to complain. To be in a show that people love and quote back at you is the reason you get into this business. I feel privileged to have that experience.’
More: TV The Nightly Show went off air for a full three minutes and nobody understood why 
True Detective's writer Nic Pizzolatto 'has penned the first two episodes' of season three 
Death shocks in Corrie and Emmerdale and 10 more big soap spoilers 
It was recently speculated however the show could return with an alternative cast , which probably won’t be welcome with open arms.
Their dancing is certainly irreplaceable.

Still spectacular.
Simon Bird has since gone onto star in a number of shows following The Inbetweeners, including Channel 4’s Friday Night Dinner and Chickens.
MORE: The Inbetweeners headteacher Greg Davies is going to be butt naked in a hot tub for Comic Relief 
MORE: Simon and Tara from The Inbetweeners, aka Joe Thomas and Hannah Tointon, are apparently engaged
